title: Ohio River Corridor Study Commission Act of 1993
content: Ohio River Corridor Study Commission Act of 1993 - Establishes the Ohio River Corridor Study Commission to study and report on: (1) the feasibility of establishing an Ohio River National Heritage Corridor for the Ohio River Corridor. And (2) the preservation, protection, improvement, enjoyment, and utilization of the historic, economic, natural, recreational, scenic, and cultural resources of the Corridor. Gives the consent and approval of the Congress to the States of Illinois, Kentucky, Indiana, Ohio, West Virginia, or Pennsylvania to enter into an interstate agreement or compact in furtherance of this Act or the study. Authorizes appropriations.
